meanings.definition: To close something by covering or blocking an opening.
meanings.sent2: He always shuts the windows before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The cat shuts its eyes when it naps.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella shuts out the rain like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The lock shuts with a satisfying click.

meanings.definition: To move something into a position that blocks an opening.
meanings.sent1: He shuts the gate to keep the dog in the yard.
meanings.sent2: She shuts the book after finishing the last page.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shuts the nut inside its cheek.
meanings.sent4: The clouds shut out the sun on a stormy day.
meanings.sent5: The lid shuts tight to keep the cookies fresh.

meanings.definition: To stop the operation of something, such as a business or service.
meanings.sent1: The store shuts early on Sundays.
meanings.sent2: They shut down the factory for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The computer shuts off when it gets too hot.
meanings.sent4: The snowstorm shuts the roads for safety.
meanings.sent5: The power outage shuts the lights in the neighborhood.
